Type.Name: NameValueFileSectionHandler

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit NameValueFileSectionHandler extends System.Object implements class System.Configuration.IConfigurationSectionHandler

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

remarks.para: The file attribute of the <appSettings> section specifies a relative path to an external file that contains custom application-configuration settings. The details provided in the file act as an <appSettings> section in the configuration file. The file is accessed using the class. The file's root element must match the section referring to it.

summary.para: Provides access to a configuration file. This type supports the .NET Framework configuration infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public object Create (object parent, object configContext, System.Xml.XmlNode section);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Create(object parent, object configContext, class System.Xml.XmlNode section) cil managed

remarks.para: The object parameter acts as the configuration settings in the corresponding parent configuration section. The object parameter is the virtual path for which the configuration section handler computes configuration values. Normally this parameter is reserved and is null. The parameter is the that contains the configuration information to be handled. The parameter provides direct access to the XML contents of the configuration section.

summary.para: Creates a new configuration handler and adds it to the section-handler collection based on the specified parameters.
